unified_fields.name: accession
unified_fields.description: Primary stable identifier for the protein entry
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Unique alphanumeric identifier that permanently identifies a protein record. UniProt uses format like P04637, RefSeq uses prefix-based format like NP_000537.3

unified_fields.name: sequence
unified_fields.description: Amino acid sequence of the protein
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Complete amino acid sequence using standard single-letter codes (ACDEFGHIKLMNPQRSTVWY)

unified_fields.name: length
unified_fields.description: Number of amino acids in the sequence
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Integer count of residues in the canonical protein sequence

unified_fields.name: organism
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Scientific name of the organism from which the protein originates

unified_fields.name: taxonomy
unified_fields.description: Taxonomic lineage from kingdom to species
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Ordered array of taxonomic ranks representing the evolutionary classification

unified_fields.name: gene
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Official gene symbol (e.g., HGNC approved symbol for human genes)

unified_fields.name: gene_id
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Numeric identifier from NCBI Gene database linking to gene record

unified_fields.name: features
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Collection of annotations mapped to specific sequence positions including domains, binding sites, PTMs, and variants

unified_fields.name: dbxrefs
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Links to related entries in other databases including PDB, Ensembl, HGNC, OMIM, etc.

unified_fields.name: definition
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Human-readable description of the protein including recommended name and organism

UniProt.name: id
UniProt.semantic_definition: Human-readable mnemonic combining protein and organism

UniProt.name: reviewed
UniProt.semantic_definition: Indicates manual curation status - reviewed entries are in Swiss-Prot

UniProt.name: proteinExistence
UniProt.semantic_definition: PE level indicating confidence in protein existence based on evidence type

UniProt.name: molWeight
UniProt.semantic_definition: Calculated molecular weight of the canonical sequence in Daltons

UniProt.name: crc64
UniProt.semantic_definition: 64-bit cyclic redundancy check for sequence verification

UniProt.name: md5
UniProt.semantic_definition: MD5 hash for sequence integrity verification

UniProt.name: proteinDescription
UniProt.semantic_definition: Structured protein nomenclature including recommended, alternative, and submitted names

UniProt.name: genes
UniProt.description: Gene names including primary and synonyms
UniProt.semantic_definition: Complete gene nomenclature including official symbol, synonyms, ordered locus names, and ORF names

UniProt.name: comments
UniProt.semantic_definition: Curated annotations covering function, disease, subcellular location, PTM, etc.

UniProt.name: keywords
UniProt.semantic_definition: Standardized terms from UniProt keyword vocabulary for categorization

RefSeq.name: gi
RefSeq.semantic_definition: Deprecated numeric identifier from NCBI GenInfo system

RefSeq.name: locus
RefSeq.semantic_definition: Locus identifier from the source genome annotation

RefSeq.name: coded_by
RefSeq.semantic_definition: Reference to the nucleotide sequence encoding this protein with CDS coordinates

RefSeq.name: chromosome
RefSeq.semantic_definition: Chromosome on which the encoding gene is located

RefSeq.name: map_location
RefSeq.semantic_definition: Cytogenetic band location on the chromosome

RefSeq.name: annotation_status
RefSeq.semantic_definition: Level of manual review and validation applied to the record

RefSeq.name: version
RefSeq.semantic_definition: Integer version incremented when sequence changes

cross_reference_mappings.notes: One UniProt entry may map to multiple RefSeq proteins (isoforms)

unified_fields.name: entry_id
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Unique identifier for the structure entry. PDB uses 4-character codes, AlphaFold uses AF-{UniProt}-F{n} format, SWISS-MODEL uses internal IDs

unified_fields.name: uniprot_accession
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Link to UniProt entry for the modeled/determined protein

unified_fields.name: sequence
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Amino acid sequence of the protein chain(s) in the structure

unified_fields.name: atom_coordinates
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Cartesian coordinates (x, y, z) in Angstroms for each atom in the structure

unified_fields.name: residue_number
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Position of the residue in the sequence (1-based)

unified_fields.name: residue_name
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Standard three-letter amino acid code (ALA, CYS, etc.)

unified_fields.name: chain_id
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Single character or short string identifying the polymer chain

unified_fields.name: b_factor
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Atomic displacement parameter (experimental) or confidence score (predicted). For AlphaFold stores pLDDT, for SWISS-MODEL stores local QMEAN

unified_fields.name: occupancy
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Fraction of molecules in crystal with atom at this position (typically 1.0 for predictions)

unified_fields.name: organism
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Scientific name of the organism from which the protein originates

unified_fields.name: tax_id
unified_fields.semantic_definition: Numeric identifier from NCBI taxonomy database

PDB.name: struct.title
examples: CRYSTAL STRUCTURE OF THE TETRAMERIZATION DOMAIN OF P53
PDB.semantic_definition: Descriptive title of the deposited structure

PDB.name: exptl.method
PDB.semantic_definition: Primary experimental technique used to determine the structure

PDB.name: refine.ls_d_res_high
PDB.semantic_definition: Highest resolution of the diffraction/reconstruction data

PDB.name: refine.ls_R_factor_R_free
PDB.semantic_definition: Cross-validation R-factor using test set reflections

PDB.name: entity.type
PDB.semantic_definition: Classification of molecular entity in the structure

PDB.name: entity_poly.type
PDB.semantic_definition: Type of polymer for protein/nucleic acid entities

PDB.name: pdbx_database_status.recvd_initial_deposition_date
PDB.semantic_definition: Date structure was deposited to the PDB

PDB.name: pdbx_database_status.status_code
PDB.semantic_definition: Release status of the entry (REL=released, HOLD=on hold, OBS=obsolete)

PDB.name: em_3d_reconstruction.resolution
PDB.semantic_definition: Resolution of cryo-EM reconstruction in Angstroms

PDB.name: pdbx_nmr_ensemble.conformers_submitted_total_number
PDB.semantic_definition: Number of conformational models in NMR ensemble

AlphaFold DB.name: entryId
AlphaFold DB.semantic_definition: Unique AlphaFold identifier in format AF-{UniProt}-F{fragment}

AlphaFold DB.name: uniprotId
AlphaFold DB.semantic_definition: UniProt mnemonic identifier for the protein

AlphaFold DB.name: modelCreatedDate
AlphaFold DB.semantic_definition: Date the AlphaFold model was generated

AlphaFold DB.name: latestVersion
AlphaFold DB.semantic_definition: AlphaFold model version (v4 is most recent)

AlphaFold DB.name: sequenceLength
AlphaFold DB.semantic_definition: Number of residues in the full UniProt sequence

AlphaFold DB.name: sequenceChecksum
AlphaFold DB.semantic_definition: CRC64 checksum of the source sequence

AlphaFold DB.name: pLDDT
AlphaFold DB.semantic_definition: Predicted local Distance Difference Test score indicating confidence in local structure

AlphaFold DB.name: predicted_aligned_error
AlphaFold DB.semantic_definition: Matrix of predicted aligned errors between all residue pairs in Angstroms

AlphaFold DB.name: max_predicted_aligned_error
AlphaFold DB.semantic_definition: Maximum value of the PAE scale (typically 31.75 Angstroms)

AlphaFold DB.name: pTM
AlphaFold DB.semantic_definition: Global fold quality metric predicting TM-score to true structure

AlphaFold DB.name: fragmentNumber
AlphaFold DB.semantic_definition: Fragment number for proteins longer than 1400 residues

SWISS-MODEL.name: model_id
SWISS-MODEL.semantic_definition: Internal SWISS-MODEL identifier for this specific model

SWISS-MODEL.name: template
SWISS-MODEL.semantic_definition: PDB template used for homology modeling

SWISS-MODEL.name: identity
SWISS-MODEL.semantic_definition: Fraction of identical residues in target-template alignment

SWISS-MODEL.name: similarity
SWISS-MODEL.semantic_definition: Fraction of similar residues (including conservative substitutions)

SWISS-MODEL.name: coverage
SWISS-MODEL.semantic_definition: Fraction of target sequence covered by the model

SWISS-MODEL.name: from
SWISS-MODEL.semantic_definition: First residue position of the modeled region

SWISS-MODEL.name: to
SWISS-MODEL.semantic_definition: Last residue position of the modeled region

SWISS-MODEL.name: qmean
SWISS-MODEL.semantic_definition: Global model quality score (higher is better, > -1 is excellent)

SWISS-MODEL.name: qmean_disco
SWISS-MODEL.semantic_definition: Distance constraint-based quality score (higher is better)

SWISS-MODEL.name: qmean_local
SWISS-MODEL.semantic_definition: Local quality estimate per residue stored in B-factor column

SWISS-MODEL.name: oligo_state
SWISS-MODEL.semantic_definition: Biological assembly state of the model

SWISS-MODEL.name: created_date
SWISS-MODEL.semantic_definition: Date the homology model was computed

SWISS-MODEL.name: template_resolution
SWISS-MODEL.semantic_definition: Resolution of the experimental template structure

SWISS-MODEL.name: template_method
SWISS-MODEL.semantic_definition: Experimental method used to determine the template structure

cross_reference_mappings.notes: Multiple PDB entries may represent same UniProt protein
Multiple models may exist per UniProt entry
AlphaFold predictions can be compared to experimental PDB structures

subcategories.note: Molecular interaction data is maintained in category 04.pathways.networks. This subcategory contains symlinks to IntAct, Reactome, and STRING in the pathways category.

global_cross_category_mappings.description: UniProt accession serves as primary key linking sequences to structures
global_cross_category_mappings.semantic_definition: Universal protein identifier enabling cross-database integration

global_cross_category_mappings.description: Gene symbols link proteins to genomic context
global_cross_category_mappings.semantic_definition: Official gene nomenclature (HGNC for human) enabling gene-protein mapping

global_cross_category_mappings.description: PDB identifier linking to 3D structural data
global_cross_category_mappings.semantic_definition: 4-character alphanumeric PDB identifier for experimental structures

global_cross_category_mappings.description: NCBI taxonomy ID for organism identification
global_cross_category_mappings.semantic_definition: Numeric identifier from NCBI taxonomy enabling organism-based queries

global_cross_category_mappings.description: Amino acid sequence enabling sequence-based matching
global_cross_category_mappings.semantic_definition: One-letter amino acid sequence for alignment and identity calculations
